intro: Erucastrum subbipinnatifidum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rockcress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant features basal leaves that are narrow and pinnately divided, giving it a distinctive, fern-like appearance. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds.
